attributes.action: Challenge the FA to reduce the admission prices for the 2007 FA Cup Final at the 'New Wembley'
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Dear Mr. Blair, we urge you, as the leader of our nation to intervene and petition the FA to reduce these outrageous prices for the FA cup final 2007. The game of football and certainly this showpiece final is being priced away from those who support it most - the fans. Those people who support their team each week, come rain or shine. How can the FA justify charging £80 or £95 to watch a game of football? A family will pay nearly £300 to go and see their team - the price of a holiday!
So I ask you sir, step in, ask the FA reconsider their pricing structure for the final, do so on behalf of the fans.
Thankyou.
